sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"冷，凉"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: cold, cool, chilly, frosty, freezing, icy
means: cold ： 最普通用词，强调缺乏温暖，使人不舒服。
cool ： 指既不太热也不太冷。
frosty ： 指雾气在寒冷物体的表面凝结成薄冰时的严寒结霜的温度。
freezing ： 指使人僵直，使东西凝固的冷。
icy ： 多指风暴、风雪和水等冷得使人感到如刺如割。

word_mean: 凉，清热除蒸等功能的药性。

sentence.Network_en: Northbridge is a cool, calculating and clever criminal who could strike again.
sentence.Network_cn: 诺思布里奇是个头脑冷静、诡计多端、阴险狡诈的罪犯，他可能还会犯案。

sentence.Network_en: She made a fanning motion, pretending to cool herself off.
sentence.Network_cn: 她做了个扇风的动作，假装想让自己凉快一点。

sentence.Network_en: In warm weather, you should wear clothing that is cool and comfortable.
sentence.Network_cn: 在热天里，应该穿凉快舒适的衣服。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cōl (noun), cōlian (verb), Germanic origin; related to Dutch koel, also to cold

encyclopedia.content: 韩国1994年出道的两男一女乐队组合「Cool」，2005年曾经宣布解散，2008年4月重新复合。乐队叁位成员金成秀、柔里 和李在勋一直合作无间，以风格独特的轻快跳舞音乐为主干，每年夏天必定推出「透心凉」的音乐专辑，深受年青人欢迎，是韩国乐坛上一个鲜有的例子。另外，cool也是著名的手表品牌。

entry.tran: 凉的;凉爽的;温度不高的
entry.def: Something that is cool has a temperature which is low but not very low.

example.ex: I felt a current of cool air...
example.tran: 我感觉到一阵凉风。

example.ex: The water was slightly cooler than a child's bath...
example.tran: 这水比小孩的洗澡水稍微凉一些。

entry.def: If it is cool, or if a place is cool, the temperature of the air is low but not very low.

example.ex: Thank goodness it's cool in here...
example.tran: 谢天谢地，这里面挺凉快。

example.ex: Store grains and cereals in a cool, dry place.
example.tran: 将粮食和谷物储存在阴凉干燥的地方。

entry.def: Clothing that is cool is made of thin material so that you do not become too hot in hot weather.

example.ex: In warm weather, you should wear clothing that is cool and comfortable.
example.tran: 在热天里，应该穿凉快舒适的衣服。

entry.def: Cool colours are light colours which give an impression of coolness.

example.ex: Choose a cool colour such as cream...
example.tran: 选择冷色系，比如乳白色。

example.ex: The drawing-room was a cool silver green.
example.tran: 客厅是冷色调的银绿色。

entry.def: When something cools or when you cool it, it becomes lower in temperature.

example.ex: Drain the meat and allow it to cool...
example.tran: 把肉沥干水，让它冷却。

example.ex: Huge fans will have to cool the concrete floor to keep it below 150 degrees.
example.tran: 必须用巨大的风扇来冷却混凝土地面，将其温度控制在150度以下。

entry.def: When a feeling or emotion cools, or when you cool it, it becomes less powerful.

example.ex: Within a few minutes tempers had cooled...
example.tran: 几分钟之内，火气就变小了。

example.ex: His weird behaviour had cooled her passion.
example.tran: 他奇怪的举动使得她的激情冷却。

entry.tran: (人、行为等)冷静的，沉着的，泰然自若的
entry.def: If you say that a person or their behaviour is cool, you mean that they are calm and unemotional, especially in a difficult situation.

example.ex: He was marvelously cool again, smiling as if nothing had happened...
example.tran: 他又变得出奇地冷静，微笑着，好像什么也没有发生过。

example.ex: At that, Reno lost her cool composure.
example.tran: 听了那句话，雷诺失去了冷静。

entry.tran: (人、行为等)冷漠的，冷淡的，不友善的
entry.def: If you say that a person or their behaviour is cool, you mean that they are unfriendly or not enthusiastic.

example.ex: I didn't like him at all. I thought he was cool, aloof, and arrogant...
example.tran: 我一点也不喜欢他，觉得他冷漠、孤僻而且傲慢。

example.ex: The idea met with a cool response...
example.tran: 人们对这个想法反应冷淡。

entry.tran: (人、行为等)酷的，时尚的，吸引人的
entry.def: If you say that a person or their behaviour is cool, you mean that they are fashionable and attractive.

example.ex: He was trying to be really cool and trendy.
example.tran: 他竭力想扮酷，赶时髦。

example.ex: ...some 15-year-old kid who thinks it's cool to do heroin.
example.tran: 认为吸食海洛因很酷的一个15岁的孩子

entry.tran: 坦然接受的;心平气和的
entry.def: If you say that someone is cool about something, you mean that they accept it and are not angry or upset about it.

example.ex: Bev was really cool about it all.
example.tran: 贝芙对这一切都表现得相当平静。

entry.tran: 非常好的;特别棒的;绝妙的
entry.def: If you say that something is cool, you think it is very good.

example.ex: Kathleen gave me a really cool dress.
example.tran: 凯瑟琳给了我一件非常漂亮的衣服。

entry.tran: (尤指轻易得到的数额)巨大的，整整
entry.def: You can use cool to emphasize that an amount or figure is very large, especially when it has been obtained easily.

example.ex: Columbia recently resigned the band for a cool $30 million.
example.tran: 哥伦比亚唱片公司最近以3,000万美元的高价再次签下这个乐队。

entry.def: If you tell someone to cool it, you want them to stop being angry and aggressive and to behave more calmly.

example.ex: Can't you guys just cool it?
example.tran: 你们能不能冷静一下？

entry.def: If you keep your cool in a difficult situation, you manage to remain calm. If you lose your cool, you get angry or upset.

example.ex: She kept her cool and managed to get herself out of the ordeal...
example.tran: 她保持着冷静与克制，努力使自己走出了这次痛苦的经历。

example.ex: The big Irishman was on the verge of losing his cool.
example.tran: 那个高大的爱尔兰人快要失去冷静了。

entry.def: If you play it cool, you deliberately behave in a calm, unemotional way because you do not want people to know you are enthusiastic or angry about something.

example.ex: It's ridiculous to play it cool if someone you're mad about is mad about you too.
example.tran: 如果让你生气的人也在生你的气，而你还要假装冷静，那就太可笑了。

means.word_mean: 1. the quality of being cool;
2. great coolness and composure under strain;
1. make cool or cooler;
2. loose heat;

sentences.sentence: "The air cooled considerably after the thunderstorm"

means.word_mean: 3. lose intensity;
1. neither warm or very cold; giving relief from heat;
2. marked by calm self-control (especially in trying circumstances); unemotional;

sentences.sentence: "the most nerveless winner in the history of the tournament"

means.word_mean: 3. (color) inducing the impression of coolness; used especially of greens and blues and violets;
4. psychologically cool and unenthusiastic; unfriendly or unresponsive or showing dislike;

sentences.sentence: "cool to the idea of higher taxes"

means.word_mean: 5. used of a number or sum and meaning without exaggeration or qualification;
6. fashionable and attractive at the time; often skilled or socially adept;

sentences.sentence: "it's not cool to arrive at a party too early"

list.explanation: 周详地考虑或斟酌(某事)

example.en: He is cooling your suggestion over.
example.zh: 他正在周详地考虑你的建议。

list.explanation: (表示对某一大数目感到惊奇) 多达，至少

example.en: He earns a cool million every year.
She earned a cool forty thousand on the Wilson deal.
example.zh: 她在威尔逊那笔交易中净赚的钱多达4万。

list.explanation: 泰然自若的，沉着从容的

example.en: This chick is so cool——no matter what happens.
example.zh: 不管发生什么事，这位姑娘总是那么从容不迫。

list.explanation: [冷漠派和"跨了的一代" 的用语]杰出的，合意的，理想的

example.en: This is a re?ally cool setup.
example.zh: 这是个真正理想的方案。

list.explanation: (音乐)和谐悦耳的，圆润的，柔和的

example.en: Doesn't he How a cool trnmpet?
example.zh: 他不是吹小号吹得顶呱呱吗？

list.explanation: [冷漠派和"跨了的一代"的用语]超脱的，不介入的，与世无争的

example.en: He's cool, don't give a shirt for nothing.
example.zh: 他是不会介入的，别跟他废话。

example.en: She is totally cool and easygoing.
example.zh: 她完全与世无争，非常随和。

example.en: He lost his cool and bolted like a rabbit.

example.zh: 那病人死在手术台上了。

example.en: Let's cool this whole business for a week or so.
example.zh: 我们把这件事整个推后一周左右再说吧。

list.explanation: 通不过(考试)，失去(好机会)

example.en: He cooled his examination in mathematics this year.
example.zh: 他今年数学没有考及格。

example.en: What a won?derful chance you've cooled !
example.zh: 你失去了一个多好的机会!

list.explanation: 不理睬，对…摆出孤傲超然的样子

example.zh: 拉尔夫对杰克的问题置之不理。

auth_sentence.content: Remove from the heat and set aside to cool.
auth_sentence.res_content: Remove from the heat and set aside to cool.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Remove from the heat and set aside to cool.

auth_sentence.res_content: Place on a wire rack to cool down fully.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Place on a wire rack to cool down fully.

auth_sentence.content: Remove from the heat and leave to cool slightly.
auth_sentence.res_content: Remove from the heat and leave to cool slightly.

Sentence.sentence: The warming will be moredramaticin some areas, less in others, and some places may even cool off.
carbon emissions come from heating, cooling and powering our homes, offices and other buildings.

While schools emphasize its usefulness-online research in class and instant polling of students, for example - a big part of the attraction is, undoubtedly, that the iPhone is cool and a hit with students.
A lot of cool stuff will be available online tomorrow.
Well, if I were you, I'd let her cool off a few days before I approach her.

means.word_mean: 凉快的, 凉爽的; 冷色的;  使人感到凉爽的

sentences.en: A cool breeze brushed his face, ruffling his hair.
sentences.cn: 一阵凉风迎面拂来, 吹乱了他的头发。

sentences.en: It's late summer; soon the days will be cooler.
sentences.cn: 夏末了, 很快天气就将更凉爽。

means.word_mean: 冷漠的; 不友好的; 冷淡的; 厚颜无耻的

sentences.en: They gave him a cool reception.

means.word_mean: (使)变凉, 冷却

sentences.en: Open the windows to cool the room.
sentences.cn: 打开窗子让房间里变凉些。

means.word_mean: (使)冷静; 镇静下来; 冷淡下来

sentences.en: By that time her enthusiasm had cooled.
sentences.cn: 到那时她的热情已经冷却了下来。

sentences.en: He gradually cooled on the project.
sentences.cn: 他对那项计划逐渐不热心了。

jushi.english: You should have seen the cool way she took my radio without even asking.
jushi.chinese: 你没瞧见她那满不在乎的样子,连问也不问就把我的收音机拿走了。

jushi.english: Warm air is going up, heavy cool air moves in to take the place of it.
jushi.chinese: 热空气上升时,大量的冷空气填充了它的位置。

jushi.english: She smoothed the lines of worry away with her cool fingers.
jushi.chinese: 她用凉爽的手指把她由于担忧而产生的皱纹抚平。
